alert.note: Alert for Cambria; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 12 at 4:14AM EST until January 13 at 9:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Southeast winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected this afternoon and evening. The wind will subside for several hours late tonight before shifting to the West- Southwest Saturday then increasing to 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 60 mph throughout the day Saturday. * WHERE...Cambria and Somerset Counties. * WHEN...From noon today to 9 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There will be a several hour lull in the wind late tonight and early Saturday morning between the strong Southeast winds and the later, post cold frontal West-Southwest winds on Saturday.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive. For high wind safety information, visit weather.gov/wind. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
